subject: Fashion
title: Mourning Dress Culture
description: A quick, practical guide to Mourning Dress Culture.

hook.text: After Prince Albert died, Queen Victoria wore black for 40 years. An entire nation followed her.

buildup.text: Victorian mourning had strict rules: full black for a year, then gray, then muted purple.

discovery.text: Special mourning fabric called crape was scratchy and uncomfortable by designâ€”grief should be felt.

twist.text: Mourning became a fashion industry. Shops sold entire wardrobes for the recently bereaved.

climax.text: Grief was performed through clothing. How long you wore black told the world how much you cared.

punchline.text: Victoria turned heartbreak into a dress code for a century.

quiz.question: What role did crape fabric play in Victorian mourning dress?
options: It was the only black fabric available at the time
It was the cheapest option for grieving families
